summary: This document is a response from T-Mobile regarding a legal demand for archived records. T-Mobile objects to the demand as overbroad and burdensome but offers to comply if the terms are modified to include payment for production costs. The document outlines the types of records available and their retention policies.
keyFacts: T-Mobile objects to the legal demand for archived records as overbroad and burdensome.
T-Mobile states it does not store or maintain the content of text messages, only billing details.
Historical cell site location information is maintained for approximately 24 months.
Archived call detail records are retained for 7 years, with older records potentially purged.
The total amount due for the records requested is $2035.00.
